node.title: Recent Registry Entries
node.doctext:
The 100 most recently added or updated registry entries, served with a hint of basil...

[% return "...would be shown here if you logged in." if $APP->isGuest($USER); my $csr = $DB->sqlSelectMany('*','registration', '','ORDER BY tstamp DESC LIMIT 100') || return 'SQL Error (prepare). Please notify a [coder]'; my $labels = ['Registry','User','Data','Comments','Profile?']; my $rows; while(my $ref = $csr->fetchrow_hashref()){ my $data = $$ref{data}; my $comments = $$ref{comments}; $data = $APP->parseAsPlainText($data); $comments = $APP->parseAsPlainText($comments); push @$rows,{ 'Registry'=>linkNode($$ref{for_registry}), 'User'=>linkNode($$ref{from_user}), 'Data'=>$data, 'Comments'=>($comments ? $comments : ' '), 'Profile?'=>['No','Yes']->[$$ref{in_user_profile}], # 'As of'=>parseSQLTstamp($$ref{tstamp}) } if (linkNode($$ref{for_registry})); # ^ RoguePoet pointed out some entries that had a blank space for "Registry", # because the registry (_id 8000) had been deleted...this was weird. # Quick hack to stop entries in deleted registries from showing up; # I'm sure someone can find a better way to do this. --alexander } return $APP->buildTable($labels,$rows,'class="registries"','center'); # 4th option centers the table, so we don't need
any more --alexander %]
